: : Rodimus Prime : : 
Rodimus thinks it over. He knew this would be a tough mission, and he only allowed it because Rattrap seemed to insists. Sense Rattrap hadn't shown up he decided to cancel it. 
Rodimus Prime: Ok, Rattrap hasn't shown himself, and I have more pressing matters to deal with. The mission is off. Nightlight, would you care to join me, love? 
OOC: Flicker is a spy looking for a way to get at Roddy right? Well Rodimus just called Nightlight love, that should give him something. 
 "Nic <wingedwarrior41@...>" <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote: Yggdrasil: Keep in touch and tell me when the Rogue Star is at 100%. I
have to go and contact Rodimus for now. Farewell, Devilcat.

He goes in the control room and opens communication with Rodimus.

Yggdrasil: Rodimus, this is Yggdrasil. I suggest that you drop that pd
rescue mission. I know it's not quite fair, but they are seemingly
Tripred pods and they fell well inside their territory. It would be
suicide to go.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "Certainly - I'm quite used to doing that."  Devilcat walks slowly 
> down the hall, familiarizing himself with the base.  The layout seems 
> fairly simple, compared to some of the places he's been.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Yggdrasil: Yes, much of it. I'll tell Rodimus when he gets back and
> > warn you if he objects on anything. For now, we might be better to
> > keep a low profile and watch them all until they get ready to 
> strike.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > "Most of it is cosmetic, but we had to procure some replacement 
> parts 
> > > for the engine and a couple of minor systems." Devilcat 
> > > explains.  "Now it's just a matter of time.  Speaking of which, I 
> > > ought to check on them."  The Rogue commander keys his comlink.
> > > 
> > > "Devilcat to base, report!"
> > > 
> > > "Hey boss, it's Fury.  They're just about finished down back."
> > > 
> > > "Excellent, excellent.  I've hammered out a treaty of sorts with 
> the 
> > > Maximals.  What's the Predacon base look like?"
> > > 
> > > "Like a tomb - nothing's happened except a few scouts going out."
> > > 
> > > "Probably means they're up to something.  If you see any 
> movement, 
> > > update me at once."
> > > 
> > > "Right, boss!"  Fury breaks the link.
> > > 
> > > Devilcat looks at Yggdrasil.  "Well, I suppose that answers your 
> > > question."
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Yggdrasil: That could be a good idea. It will all depend on how 
> the
> > > > Tripreds want to act it out also, on their strategy. Can your 
> tell 
> > > me
> > > > what damages your ship suffers and how long it will be until 
> it's
> > > > repaired? 
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > "That will not be an issue once Rogue Star is repaired." 
> Devilcat 
> > > > > says confidently.  "It may be smaller than a battlecruiser, 
> but 
> > > it's 
> > > > > much faster and its armament and shields are roughly on a par 
> > > with 
> > > > > the Tripred ship.  If we can bring it into play, their 
> firepower 
> > > > > advantage will be negated.  And its cloaking ability is quite 
> > > useful 
> > > > > for setting traps."  Devilcat smiles as an idea strikes 
> > > him.  "That 
> > > > > could be used to our advantage here as well.  If the enemy 
> comes 
> > > > > expecting the defense capabilities of one starship and they 
> are 
> > > met 
> > > > > with two, it will make a mess of their attack plans.  Too bad 
> it 
> > > > > would only work once."
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Yggdrasil nods hesitatingly.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Yggdrasil: Establishing a good defense would allow our 
> forces to
> > > > > > destroy any attackers, but we would then need to root them 
> out,
> > > > > > whoever attacks first. In this case, The maximals could 
> hold 
> > > the 
> > > > > line
> > > > > > here while the Rogues go and destroy the remaining 
> attackers at 
> > > > > their
> > > > > > base. The preds tend to strike with all forces, but I don't 
> > > know 
> > > > > about
> > > > > > the Tripreds. Besides, their ship seemed to be quite well 
> > > defended.
> > > > > > That would be very hard.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 
> <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > > "I understand that the Tripreds are much more dangerous," 
> > > > > Devilcat 
> > > > > > > points out.  "But harsh experience has taught me never to 
> > > > > discount an 
> > > > > > > opposing force, no matter how weak it may seem.  If we 
> focus 
> > > all 
> > > > > our 
> > > > > > > attention on the Tripredacus forces, Hydras is free to 
> strike 
> > > as 
> > > > > he 
> > > > > > > chooses.  And I know from doing it myself how devastating 
> > > that 
> > > > > tactic 
> > > > > > > is when done properly.  A better plan would be to wait 
> for 
> > > one or 
> > > > > the 
> > > > > > > other to make a move, then counter it."
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic 
> <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > Yggdrasil: Alright, but remember I have to talk to you 
> as 
> > > one 
> > > > > > > officer
> > > > > > > > to another.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Yggdrasil looked at Devilcat.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Yggdrasil: I don't want the Tripreds to take hold here, 
> but 
> > > I 
> > > > > hope 
> > > > > > > you
> > > > > > > > see why they are the real threat, not the Preds.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus gets up, looking to the guests on the 
> otherside 
> > > of 
> > > > > his 
> > > > > > > desk.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus Prime: If you'll excuse me, I have to go deal 
> > > with 
> > > > > this 
> > > > > > > pod
> > > > > > > > problem. If you need anything just contact Kup over the 
> > > base 
> > > > > comm
> > > > > > > > system. He'll see that you get quarters or anything 
> else 
> > > you 
> > > > > need.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus heads out of the base, transforming to car 
> mode. 
> > > He 
> > > > > opens 
> > > > > > > a
> > > > > > > > comm to Rattrap.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus Prime: Rattrap, I'm waiting outside the base. 
> > > Let's 
> > > > > go get
> > > > > > > > that pod.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Roddy then switches his comm to Nightlight's channel.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus Prime: Nightlight, honey, would you like to 
> make 
> > > a pod
> > > > > > > > recovery run with me?
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > : : Kup : :
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Kup: Katya, would you like to go present our plan to 
> > > Rodimus 
> > > > > now?
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > >
